00020 /**
00021  * @file   PgOptions.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet && harley
00023  * @date   Tue May  3 11:49:37 2005
00024  * @brief  Classes for reading program command line options.
00025  */
00026 
00027 /*
00028   @page PgOptions MANUAL: PgOptions (NON-OFFICIAL-RELEASE)
00029 
00030   @section PgOptionsContents Contents
00031 
00032   @section PgOptionsIntro Introduction
00033 
00034   PgOptions is the APT library for working with command line
00035   options.  With this library, a program can declare the
00036   list of options it supports along with their kind and
00037   defaults.  PgOptions will process the command line and
00038   then the program can query what was set.
00039 
00040   Like standard unix programs, an option of "--" ends option
00041   parsing.  All the remaning arguments are args to the
00042   program.
00043 
00044   There are three kinds of options: BOOL, DOUBLE and STRING.
00045   All three kinds may have a value appended to the option name with "=".
00046   (Like: "--double-example=10.5", "--output-dir=foo".)
00047 
00048   BOOL values may have a prefix of "-no-" or "--no-" to set
00049   the value to "false".  If the arg after a bool option is
00050   "true/1" or "false/0" it is used as the value.  Otherwise
00051   the option is set to true.  (Note that this might make
00052   working with a file called "true" ambiguous.  In that case
00053   use "--" to seperate the args from the option.)
00054 
00055   Non-option args to the program are put into the "args"
00056   list which the program can retreive with "getArg(idx)".
00057 
00058   @section PgOptionsExample Example
00059 
00060   Normal usage looks like:
00061 
00062 @verbatim
00063 int main (int argc,char* argv[]) {
00064 
00065   PgOptions opts;
00066   opts->setUsage("A nice paragraph about what this program does.");
00067   opts->defineOption("p","print",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00068                      "Do you want to print the output?",
00069                      "true");
00070 
00071   opts->parseArgv(argv);
00072 
00073   if (opts->getBool("print")) {
00074     doPrint();
00075   }
00076 }
00077 @endverbatim
00078 
00079   @section PgOptionsNotes Notes
00080 
00081   * Please try and write the options in the "positive sense".
00082   If the default is to print, then define the option "print"
00083   to be true.  The user can use "--no-print" when they dont
00084   want to.  (Dont define "--no-print".)
00085 
00086  */
00087 
00088 #ifndef PGOPTIONS_H
00089 #define PGOPTIONS_H
00090 
00091 // "APT_PGOPTIONS_NO_XERCES" is used to remove the use of
00092 // Xerces XML functions in PgOptions.
00093 // affy/exact uses PgOptions, but has no need of XML.
00094 // providing an option to disable
00095

00106 /// @class PgOpt
00107 /// @brief The definition of this option and the values.
00108 class APTLIB_API PgOpt {
00109 public:
00110   /** Types of allowed options. */
00111   typedef enum PgOptType {
00112     INVALID_OPT,
00113     BOOL_OPT,
00114     DOUBLE_OPT,
00115     INT_OPT,
00116     STRING_OPT,
00117   } PgOptType_t;
00118 
00119 public:
00120   std::string m_shortName;           ///< Short name without the '-' (-h -> h).
00121   std::string m_longName;            ///< Long name without the '--' prefix.
00122   //
00123   std::string m_help;                ///< Maybe help, possibly NULL.
00124   bool        m_nohelp;              ///< Suppress usage printing, including defaults. 
00125   PgOptType   m_type;                ///< Type of option.
00126   std::string m_defaultValue;        ///< Default value if any.
00127   std::vector<std::string> m_values; ///< Values for this option.
00128   int         m_allowMultiple;       ///< Allow mutiple args
00129   //int         m_numargs;
00130 
00131   /// @brief     Creates and inits a new PgOpt
00132   PgOpt();
00133   PgOpt(const PgOpt* orig);
00134 
00135   /// @brief     Allows mutiple values for this option?
00136   /// @param     val       1=yes 0=no
00137   void allowMutipleValues(int val);
00138   /// @brief     was this option set by the user?
00139   /// @return    true if it was set, false if it is the default value.
00140   ///            This should be called "isUserSet".
00141   bool isSet();
00142   /// @brief     The number of values for this option.
00143   /// @return    int
00144   int getValueCount() const;
00145   /// @brief     Get the string value of this option
00146   /// @param     idx       (optional) the index
00147   /// @return    string value
00148   std::string getValue(size_t idx=0) const;
00149   /// @brief     Get the value as a boolean.  Abort if it cant be converted.
00150   /// @param     idx       (optional) the index
00151   /// @return    boolean
00152   bool   getValueBool(int idx=0) const;
00153   /// @brief     Get the value as an int. Abort if it cant be converted.
00154   /// @param     idx       (optional) the index
00155   /// @return    the value as an int
00156   int    getValueInt(int idx=0) const;
00157   /// @brief     Get the value as a double. Abort if it cant be converted.
00158   /// @param     idx       (optional) the index
00159   /// @return    the value as a double
00160   double getValueDouble(int idx=0) const;
00161   /// @brief     The default value of this option
00162   /// @return    string
00163   std::string getDefaultValue() const;
00164 
00165   /// @brief     Clear all the values on this option
00166   void clearValues();
00167   /// @brief     Set the value of this option to a single value.
00168   /// @param     new_value
00169   void setValue(const std::string &new_value) {
00170     m_values.resize(0);
00171     pushValue(new_value);
00172   }
00173   /// @brief     Push the new value onto the list of values for this option.
00174   /// @param     new_value
00175   /// @remarks   only valid for options which allow mutiple values.
00176   void pushValue(const std::string& new_value);
00177   /// @brief     same as clearValues()
00178   void resetToDefault();
00179 
00180   std::vector<std::string> getValueVector() const;
00181 
00182   /// @brief     Check to see if the parse of the string is ok for this option.
00183   /// @param     value     string to parse.
00184   /// @return    1 if ok.
00185   int checkParseIsOk(const std::string& value) const;
00186 
00187   /// @brief     Push all our user supplied values into another vector.
00188   /// @param     dest_vec   vector to add them to.
00189   void push_user_values_into(std::vector<std::string>& dest_vec);
00190 
00191   /// @brief     Dump the internal state of the option for debugging.
00192   void dump() const;
00193 };

00264   /// @brief     define an option to be handled by this option parser.
00265   /// @param     shortName    one or two letter option name.
00266   /// @param     longName     full length option name.
00267   /// @param     type         the type of option (string,int,bool,double)
00268   /// @param     help         help text.
00269   /// @param     defaultVal Default value to use if not set.
00270   /// @return    pointer to the PgOpt created.
00271   /// @remarks   This calls addPgOpt to add the created option to the option state.

00280   /// @param     shortName
00281   /// @param     longName

00287                 const std::string& longName,
00288                 PgOpt::PgOptType_t type,
00289                 const std::string& help,
00290                 const std::string& defaultVal,

00295   /// @param     type
00296   /// @param     help
00297   /// @param     defaultVal

00299   PgOpt* defOptMult(const std::string& shortName,
00300                     const std::string& longName,
00301                     PgOpt::PgOptType_t type,
00302                     const std::string& help,
00303                     const std::string& defaultVal,

00306   /// @brief     Define a new section for options
00307   /// @param     sectionName name for the section
00308   /// @return    void
00309   void defineOptionSection(const std::string &sectionName);
00310   /// @brief     Copies and adds an PgOpt to the internal state.
00311   /// @param     option    option to add
00312   /// @return    pointer to copy.
00313   PgOpt* addPgOpt(const PgOpt *option);
00314   /// @brief     Adds an PgOpt to the internal state.
00315   /// @param     option    option to add
00316   /// @return    pointer to the passed in option
00317   PgOpt* addPgOpt_nocopy(PgOpt *option);
00318 
00319   /// @brief     Add the option name and PgOpt to our map of name,value pairs
00320   /// @param     opt_name  name to bind.  null strings ("") are ignored.
00321   /// @param     opt       option for this name.
00322   void bind(const std::string& opt_name,PgOpt* opt);
00323 
00324   /// @brief     Finds the option which is bound to this name.
00325   /// @param     name
00326   /// @return    pointer to option or NULL
00327   PgOpt* findOpt(const std::string &longName)
00328   {
00329     optionMapIterator_t i = m_option_map.find(longName);
00330     if (i == m_option_map.end()) {
00331         return NULL;
00332     }
00333     return i->second;
00334   }
00335   /// @brief     Same as findOpt, but aborts if not option is not found.
00336   /// @param     name
00337   /// @return    pointer to option
00338   PgOpt* mustFindOpt(const std::string &name)
00339   {
00340     PgOpt *opt = findOpt(name);
00341     if(opt == NULL) {
00342         Err::errAbort("Don't recognize option with name: '" + name + "'.");
00343     }
00344     return opt;
00345   }
00346 
00347   /// @brief Print a string wrapping at max width from the current position.
00348   /// @param str - The cstring to be printed.
00349   /// @param prefix - How many spaces to put on begining of newline.
00350   /// @param maxWidth - Where to wrap text at.
00351   /// @param currentPos - What position in the line is cursor currently at.
00352   static void printStringWidth(const std::string& str, int prefix=0,int currentPos=0, int maxWidth=70);

00356   void usage(bool printOpts = true);

00359   /// @param argv Arguments supplied to program.  argv[0] is the program name.
00360   /// @param start The position to start parsing at (default 1)
00361   /// @return the last position in argv parsed (will stop at "--")
00362  int parseArgv(const char * const * const argv, int start = 1);
00363   /// @brief the args to m_arg
00364   /// @param argv Arguments to copy

00367   /// @brief     Match the arg found at argv[arg_idx].
00368   /// @param     arg_idx   arg_idx is updated to point to the next arg to match.
00369   void matchOneArg(size_t* arg_idx);
00370   /// @brief     Clear the values for an option
00371   /// @param     name       the name of the option
00372   void clear(const std::string &name);
00373   /// @brief     Set the value of an option
00374   /// @param     name       the name of the option
00375   /// @param     new_value  the value of the option
00376   void set(const std::string &name, const std::string &new_value) {
00377       if ((isOptDefined("xml-file")) && (name == "xml-file"))
00378       {
00379         if (mustFindOpt(name)->isSet()) {
00380           Err::errAbort("The xml-file option has already been set. Only one xml-file can be specified.");
00381         }
00382         std::vector<std::string> vFileNames;
00383         setOptionsFromXMLFile(new_value, vFileNames);
00384       }
00385       mustFindOpt(name)->setValue(new_value);
00386   }
00387   /// @brief     Add a value to an option vector
00388   /// @param     name       the name of the option
00389   /// @param     value      the value to push
00390   void push(const std::string &name, const std::string &value) {
00391     mustFindOpt(name)->pushValue(value);
00392   }
00393   /// @brief     Get the value of the option as a string.
00394   /// @param     opt_name  option name (short or long)
00395   /// @return    the value.  Abort if not found.
00396   std::string get(const std::string& opt_name)
00397   {
00398     PgOpt *opt = mustFindOpt(opt_name);
00399     return opt->getValue(0);
00400   }
00401   /// @brief     Get the value of the option as a boolean.
00402   /// @param     opt_name  option name (short or long)
00403   /// @return    the value.  Abort if not found.
00404   bool getBool(const std::string& opt_name);
00405   /// @brief     Get the value of the option as a double.
00406   /// @param     opt_name  option name (short or long)
00407   /// @return    the value.  Abort if not found.
00408   double getDouble(const std::string& opt_name);
00409   /// @brief     Get the value of the option as a int.
00410   /// @param     opt_name  option name (short or long)
00411   /// @return    the value.  Abort if not found.
00412   int getInt(const std::string& opt_name);
